intro: Hieracium sernanderianum, commonly known as the Sernander's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, with yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium sernanderianum is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
